ghostPost.title: Launching the Journey to Traefik
ghostPost.excerpt: In this video Julien Salleyron, Distinguished Engineer at Traefik Labs, will walk you through the core elements of Traefik, including how to parse the configuration, listening to incoming traffic, creating the providers, and how to create the TCP/UDP/HTTP reverse proxies.
ghostPost.custom_excerpt: In this video Julien Salleyron, Distinguished Engineer at Traefik Labs, will walk you through the core elements of Traefik, including how to parse the configuration, listening to incoming traffic, creating the providers, and how to create the TCP/UDP/HTTP reverse proxies.
ghostPost.meta_description: Here Julien Salleyron discusses the core elements of Traefik, including parsing configuration, listening to incoming traffic, and how to create providers.
ghostPost.plaintext:
In this video Julien Salleyron, Distinguished Engineer at Traefik Labs, will
walk you through the core elements of Traefik, including how to parse the
configuration, listen to incoming traffic, create the providers, and how to
create the TCP/UDP/HTTP reverse proxies.
ghostPost.html: In this video Julien Salleyron, Distinguished Engineer at Traefik Labs, will walk you through the core elements of Traefik, including how to parse the configuration, listen to incoming traffic, create the providers, and how to create the TCP/UDP/HTTP reverse proxies.

node.title: RiksTV's Cloud Infrastructure Using Traefik
node.excerpt: In this online meetup, Trond Hindenes from RiksTV shows how Traefik fits into RiksTVs stack, and how it fits together with other products such as ALB, Kubernetes and Consul.
node.custom_excerpt: In this online meetup, Trond Hindenes from RiksTV shows how Traefik fits into RiksTVs stack, and how it fits together with other products such as ALB, Kubernetes and Consul.
node.meta_title: RiksTV's Cloud Infrastructure Using Traefik
node.meta_description: Trond Hindenes from RiksTV shows how Traefik fits into RiksTVs stack, and how it fits together with other products such as ALB, Kubernetes and Consul.
node.plaintext:
Traefik has been an important part of RiksTVs cloud infrastructure since day
one, both for traditional services and for our Kubernetes-based workloads. In
this online meetup, Trond Hindenes from RiksTV shows how Traefik fits into
RiksTVs stack, and how it fits together with other products such as ALB,
Kubernetes and Consul.
node.html: Traefik has been an important part of RiksTVs cloud infrastructure since day one, both for traditional services and for our Kubernetes-based workloads. In this online meetup, Trond Hindenes from RiksTV shows how Traefik fits into RiksTVs stack, and how it fits together with other products such as ALB, Kubernetes and Consul.

node.title: Real Life Examples from Rookout to Optimize your Traefik Onboarding Experience

node.title: Deploy, Configure, and Monitor Traefik with Prometheus and Grafana by Brian Christner, 56K.Cloud
node.excerpt: In this session, Brian walks through how to gather metrics from Traefik and scrape them with Prometheus and visualize the metrics in Grafana. Why should we enable Traefik metrics? Monitoring provides observability not only to Traefik but the workloads which Traefik is managing.
node.custom_excerpt: In this session, Brian walks through how to gather metrics from Traefik and scrape them with Prometheus and visualize the metrics in Grafana. Why should we enable Traefik metrics? Monitoring provides observability not only to Traefik but the workloads which Traefik is managing.
node.meta_title: Deploy, Configure, and Monitor Traefik with Prometheus & Grafana
node.meta_description: This session discusses observability, and demos how to gather metrics from Traefik, scrape them with Prometheus, and how to visualize metrics in Grafana.
node.plaintext:
Here, we walk through how to gather metrics from Traefik and scrape them with
Prometheus and visualize the metrics in Grafana. These metrics will help you to
make data driven decisions about your workloads from troubleshooting to feature
adoption.
node.html: Here, we walk through how to gather metrics from Traefik and scrape them with Prometheus and visualize the metrics in Grafana. These metrics will help you to make data driven decisions about your workloads from troubleshooting to feature adoption.

node.title: Reducing Cloud Costs, Improving Flexibility, and Providing Resiliency with Traefik
node.excerpt: At Virginia Tech, Traefik has been used in numerous ways to benefit development, and deployment of containerized workloads. But, two use cases have been fairly unique, and we're excited to show them off to you in this session!
node.custom_excerpt: At Virginia Tech, Traefik has been used in numerous ways to benefit development, and deployment of containerized workloads. But, two use cases have been fairly unique, and we're excited to show them off to you in this session!
node.meta_title: Reducing Cloud Costs and Providing Resiliency with Traefik
node.meta_description: This session shows how to use Traefik's routing rules in a dynamic QA environment that supports many feature branch deployments on AWS, reducing CapEx.
node.plaintext:
At Virginia Tech, Traefik has been used in numerous ways to benefit
development, and deployment of containerized workloads. In this Online Meetup,
Michael Irwin shows how to use Traefik's routing rules in a dynamic QA
environment that supports many feature branch deployments on AWS, and helps to
keep cloud costs to a minimum.
node.html: At Virginia Tech, Traefik has been used in numerous ways to benefit development, and deployment of containerized workloads. In this Online Meetup, Michael Irwin shows how to use Traefik's routing rules in a dynamic QA environment that supports many feature branch deployments on AWS, and helps to keep cloud costs to a minimum.

node.title: How Snabble Built a Production-Ready Container Platform Using Traefik Enterprise Edition
node.excerpt: In this session, Gregor will provide the insider scoop on how the team at Snabble designed their container platform using Traefik Enterprise Edition. This session will feature a quick introduction on how to setup a Docker Swarm cluster, deploy services, and expose them through Traefik.

This session will feature a quick introduction on how to setup a Docker Swarm cluster, deploy services, and expose them through Traefik.
node.meta_title: How to Build Production-Ready Platform Using Traefik Enterprise
node.meta_description: This session demonstrates how to increase the availability, security, and handling of `Let's Encrypt` TLS Certificates using Traefik Enterprise Edition.
node.plaintext:
In this session, Gregor provides the insider scoop on how the team at Snabble
designed their container platform using Traefik Enterprise Edition. He
demonstrates how to increase the availability, security, and handling of `Let's
Encrypt` TLS Certificates using TraefikEE.
node.html: In this session, Gregor provides the insider scoop on how the team at Snabble designed their container platform using Traefik Enterprise Edition. He demonstrates how to increase the availability, security, and handling of `Let's Encrypt` TLS Certificates using TraefikEE.

node.title: Maesh, a Simpler Service Maesh. Presented by The Traefik Team!
node.excerpt: This Meetup shares how Maesh works in-depth and how you can install it to your clusters. And, will be presented by Traefik's developer team! We’ll show live demos, and respond to questions direct from the Community!
node.custom_excerpt: This Meetup shares how Maesh works in-depth and how you can install it to your clusters. And, will be presented by Traefik's developer team! We’ll show live demos, and respond to questions direct from the Community!
node.meta_title: Maesh, a Simpler Service Maesh. Presented by The Traefik Team!
node.meta_description: This meetup shows how our container-native service mesh, with features like  OpenTracing and TCP, fits as your de facto in Kubernetes clusters easily.
node.plaintext:
This online meetup shares how Maesh works in-depth and how you can install it to
your clusters. We cover how to use this simple, yet full-featured service mesh.
The session dives into all of the features users would typically expect to see:
OpenTracing, Metrics, load balancing, grPC, Websockets, TCP, retries, rate
limiting, circuit-breakers, fail-overs and many more. Learn why and how to make
it your de-facto service mesh for your Kubernetes clusters.
node.html: This online meetup shares how Maesh works in-depth and how you can install it to your clusters. We cover how to use this simple, yet full-featured service mesh. The session dives into all of the features users would typically expect to see: OpenTracing, Metrics, load balancing, grPC, Websockets, TCP, retries, rate limiting, circuit-breakers, fail-overs and many more. Learn why and how to make it your de-facto service mesh for your Kubernetes clusters.

Les Tilleuls Coop uses the power of Docker Swarm orchestration and Traefik
service management to be able to deploy easily and iterate as fast as possible.

of Traefik, and demonstrate how to scale containers.
node.html: Les Tilleuls Coop uses the power of Docker Swarm orchestration and Traefik service management to be able to deploy easily and iterate as fast as possible. This session will share how to manage multiple projects using a single instance of Traefik, and demonstrate how to scale containers.

node.title: eBay Classifieds Group chooses Traefik to achieve load balancing at scale
node.excerpt: eBay Classifieds Group needed an advanced load balancer and an API Gateway for advanced routing to control traffic flow with flexible configuration and automation capabilities. This complexity makes it difficult to find a good load balancer.

node.title: Practice of eXtreme DevOps with Traefik
node.excerpt: Practice of eXtreme DevOps with Traefik presented by James Pic, CTO, YourLabs.
node.custom_excerpt: Practice of eXtreme DevOps with Traefik presented by James Pic, CTO, YourLabs.
node.meta_title: Practice of eXtreme DevOps with Traefik presented by James Pic, CTO, YourLabs
node.meta_description: eXtreme DevOps is the practice of an extremely aggressive Continuous Delivery strategy where each patch push deploys an ephemeral deployment such as branchname.ci.example.com.
node.plaintext:
eXtreme DevOps is the practice of an extremely aggressive Continuous Delivery
strategy where each patch push deploys an ephemeral deployment such as
branchname.ci.example.com. With Traefik, it's easy to do, and James Pic makes it
the standard practice for his customers, from private companies of all sizes,
and to government organizations. In this session, James demos his expertise
using Traefik to practice eXtreme DevOps for his customers.
node.html: eXtreme DevOps is the practice of an extremely aggressive Continuous Delivery strategy where each patch push deploys an ephemeral deployment such as branchname.ci.example.com. With Traefik, it's easy to do, and James Pic makes it the standard practice for his customers, from private companies of all sizes, and to government organizations. In this session, James demos his expertise using Traefik to practice eXtreme DevOps for his customers.

handle all of their reverse proxy needs, enabling them through open source
tooling.
node.html: CloudOps shares how using Traefik as a workload inside Kubernetes, helps them handle all of their reverse proxy needs, enabling them through open source tooling.

node.title: Traefik Enterprise Demo
node.excerpt: Demo Video. Traefik Enterprise is a cloud-native load balancer and Kubernetes ingress controller that eases networking complexity at scale.
node.custom_excerpt: Demo Video. Traefik Enterprise is a cloud-native load balancer and Kubernetes ingress controller that eases networking complexity at scale.
node.meta_title: A Demo of Traefik Enterprise, the cloud-native reverse proxy
node.meta_description: Demo Video of Traefik Enterprise, a popular cloud-native load balancer and Kubernetes ingress controller that eases networking complexity at scale.
node.plaintext:
Traefik Enterprise  is a cloud-native load balancer and Kubernetes ingress
controller that eases networking complexity at scale. Built on top of the
popular open source reverse proxy Traefik, Traefik Enterprise brings exclusive
distributed features with high performance capabilities enabling you to load
balance your applications, secure your services with authentication and
encryption and provide end-to-end monitoring and real-time tracing. Let’s take a
deeper look at each of these.
node.html: Traefik Enterprise  is a cloud-native load balancer and Kubernetes ingress controller that eases networking complexity at scale. Built on top of the popular open source reverse proxy Traefik, Traefik Enterprise brings exclusive distributed features with high performance capabilities enabling you to load balance your applications, secure your services with authentication and encryption and provide end-to-end monitoring and real-time tracing. Let’s take a deeper look at each of these.

node.title: Managing Traffic Everywhere: Bare Metal to Containers to the Public Cloud
node.excerpt: Join us as Phil Fenstermacher, Lead Linux engineer at William & Mary, demos how they are using Traefik to manage William & Mary’s infrastructure.
node.custom_excerpt: Join us as Phil Fenstermacher, Lead Linux engineer at William & Mary, demos how they are using Traefik to manage William & Mary’s infrastructure.
node.meta_title: Managing Traefik in Bare Metal, Containers & Public Cloud With Traefik
node.meta_description: This session demonstrates how William & Mary, the top university, uses Traefik to manage a heterogeneous infrastructure, using Docker Swarm and Kubernetes.
node.plaintext:
William & Mary’s IT department supports a wide range of services. Some are
delivered directly from bare metal to the client while others run in
auto-scaling container clusters. Here Phil Fenstermacher, Lead Linux engineer at
William & Mary, demos how they are using Traefik to manage William & Mary’s
infrastructure.
node.html: William & Mary’s IT department supports a wide range of services. Some are delivered directly from bare metal to the client while others run in auto-scaling container clusters. node.title: Access Policy at the Network Layer: Using Open Policy Agent with Traefik for Safer, more Manageable Security Policy
node.excerpt: This session by Weaveworks covers common design patterns Kubernetes cluster operators use to address application level policies, and defines when and why to use each type.
node.custom_excerpt: This session by Weaveworks covers common design patterns Kubernetes cluster operators use to address application level policies, and defines when and why to use each type.

node.meta_description: This session covers common design patterns Kubernetes cluster operators use to address application level policies and defines when and why to use each type.
node.plaintext:
This session with Weaveworks covers common design patterns Kubernetes cluster
operators use to address application level policies, and defines when and why to
use each type. Paul Curtis of Weaveworks demonstrates when and why to use
Traefik's middleware in order to allow policy to be implemented, utilizing the
tools available in Traefik.
node.html: This session with Weaveworks covers common design patterns Kubernetes cluster operators use to address application level policies, and defines when and why to use each type. Paul Curtis of Weaveworks demonstrates when and why to use Traefik's middleware in order to allow policy to be implemented, utilizing the tools available in Traefik.

node.title: Kubernetes, Ingress and Traefik Usage at CERN
node.excerpt: This talk describes multiple use cases for containers and Kubernetes at CERN with details on how they use Traefik as the default ingress controller.

node.title: Service Mesh Architectures Explained - Sidecar and Beyond
node.excerpt: Service Meshes are one of the most hyped topics in the containerized world nowadays, as they allow for visibility and management of the traffic that flows inside a Kubernetes cluster.  This talk provides an overview about the different patterns utilized by different service mesh solutions.
node.custom_excerpt: Service Meshes are one of the most hyped topics in the containerized world nowadays, as they allow for visibility and management of the traffic that flows inside a Kubernetes cluster.  This talk provides an overview about the different patterns utilized by different service mesh solutions.
node.meta_title: Service Mesh Architectures Explained - Sidecar and Beyond
node.meta_description: This talk shares the different patterns utilized by different service mesh solutions, and highlights its benefits and risks provided by each approach.
node.plaintext:
Service Meshes are one of the most hyped topics in the containerized world
nowadays, as they allow for visibility and management of the traffic that flows
inside a Kubernetes cluster.  This talk provides an overview about the different
patterns utilized by different service mesh solutions, and highlights its
benefits and risks as well as the limits provided by each approach.
node.html: Service Meshes are one of the most hyped topics in the containerized world nowadays, as they allow for visibility and management of the traffic that flows inside a Kubernetes cluster.  This talk provides an overview about the different patterns utilized by different service mesh solutions, and highlights its benefits and risks as well as the limits provided by each approach.

node.title: Plugin to Traefik: Create and Publish Your Own Middleware
node.excerpt: In this meetup, Kevin discusses Traefik Plugins and how to build your custom middleware. Learn how to develop a plugin using Go, test it locally in development mode, how to publish the plugin on the Traefik Pilot marketplace, and how to deploy the new plugin onto a production system.

node.title: Creating (k8s) workshop environments with Traefik using GitOps
node.excerpt: In this presentation, Lucas Käldström teaches how to create a a dedicated web-based Kubernetes 'portal', including using GitOps with Flux, Ingress Routing with Traefik, DNS setup with external-dns, VS Code running in the browser with code-server, and the cloud-hosted setup.
node.custom_excerpt: In this presentation, Lucas Käldström teaches how to create a a dedicated web-based Kubernetes 'portal', including using GitOps with Flux, Ingress Routing with Traefik, DNS setup with external-dns, VS Code running in the browser with code-server, and the cloud-hosted setup.
node.meta_title: Creating (k8s) workshop environments with Traefik using GitOps
node.meta_description: Lucas Käldström teaches how to make a dedicated web-based Kubernetes 'portal' using GitOps, Ingress Routing with Traefik, and DNS setup with external-dns.
node.plaintext:
In this presentation, Lucas Käldström teaches how to create a dedicated
web-based Kubernetes 'portal,' including using GitOps with Flux, Ingress Routing
with Traefik, DNS setup with external-dns, VS Code running in the browser with
code-server, and the cloud-hosted setup. Lucas demonstrates all of these
components, which are bundled into an open-source tool called workshopctl.
node.html: In this presentation, Lucas Käldström teaches how to create a dedicated web-based Kubernetes 'portal,' including using GitOps with Flux, Ingress Routing with Traefik, DNS setup with external-dns, VS Code running in the browser with code-server, and the cloud-hosted setup. Lucas demonstrates all of these components, which are bundled into an open-source tool called workshopctl.

node.title: Launching the Journey to Traefik
node.excerpt: In this video Julien Salleyron, Distinguished Engineer at Traefik Labs, will walk you through the core elements of Traefik, including how to parse the configuration, listening to incoming traffic, creating the providers, and how to create the TCP/UDP/HTTP reverse proxies.
node.custom_excerpt: In this video Julien Salleyron, Distinguished Engineer at Traefik Labs, will walk you through the core elements of Traefik, including how to parse the configuration, listening to incoming traffic, creating the providers, and how to create the TCP/UDP/HTTP reverse proxies.
